name: instrumentally
content:
instrumentally adverb
(MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that refers to playing musical instruments rather than singing: The music was excellent both vocally and instrumentally. Instrumentally, the band is rather weak.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is a brilliant album, both instrumentally and in terms of the vocal arrangements.They play an instrumentally demanding style of rock music.

instrumentally adverb
(INFLUENTIALLY)
formal in a way that has an important influence in causing something to happen: He was instrumentally powerful in pushing through the policy. Self-esteem is good both instrumentally and for its own sake.
More examplesFewer examplesI believe that freedom instrumentally increases the welfare of society.The network can be considered instrumentally as a means of spreading information.
